<title level="1" right="Rules">[Mounted Defenses](/Rules.aspx?ID=2436)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 437 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Attackers can target either you or your mount. An area effect affects both of you as long as you're both in the area. You are in an attacker's reach or range if any square of your mount is within reach or range. Because your mount is larger than you and you share its space, you have lesser cover against attacks targeting you when you're mounted if the mount would be in the way (as determined by the GM).

Because you can't move your body as freely while you're riding a mount, you take a –2 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves while mounted. Additionally, the only [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=658) action you can use is the [Mount](/Actions.aspx?ID=2314) action to dismount.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
